alert.note: Alert for Morris; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:04PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Morris and east central Warren Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 804 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hackettstown, or 13 miles south of Newton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dover, Hackettstown, Wharton, Rockaway, Mount Arlington, Mendham, Stanhope, Netcong, Peapack And Gladstone, Chester, Victory Gardens, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Succasunna, Succasunna-Kenvil, Budd Lake, Beatyestown, Long Valley and Bernardsville. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 20 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern and northwestern New Jersey.
